page.title: 14DECLINE AT THE SEASIDE.
page.content:
'Decline at the Seaside' The Evening Argus (JULY '85)
A report out on the 15th July 1985 showed that Brighton was going downhill.People are moving out but the housing problem still remains acute with extortionately high rents and rates; unemployment has risen and there is a mismatch between jobs being created in the offices and people being laid off from manufacturing.The only growth sector has been in office work where 6,000 new jobs were created in the area between 1971 and 1981; rising car ownership has put pressure on the pre-existing road pattern and parking.About 250,000 cars pass through central Brighton every weekday;and the shopping centre is declining as the development of out of town hypermarkets continues.
